alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grenada; Montgomery; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:35AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Carroll, southeastern Grenada, western Webster and Montgomery Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 435 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carrollton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jefferson around 445 AM CDT. Winona around 450 AM CDT. Elliott and Duck Hill around 500 AM CDT. Sweatman around 510 AM CDT. Misterton, Lodi and Gore Springs around 515 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for north central Mississippi.
